bcl:section.bcl:text: Where a regional manager issues a guide outfitter licence which attaches a quota as a condition of licence, he may specify

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: species of game and their age, sex, horn or antler classification, and numbers of each class or classification of game that may be harvested,

the number of hunters or a class of hunters that may hunt a species in a defined time and area.

change.changenote: Section 1.041 BEFORE re-numbered and (2) and (3) were added by BC Reg 1/2019, effective January 2, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Guide outfitter licence term and condition
bcl:section.bcl:text: It is a term and condition of every guide outfitter licence that the holder must not block or damage a road, trail, airstrip or watercourse or other real or personal property while providing services under a guide outfitter licence.

change.changenote: Section 1.05 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 18/2015, effective April 1, 2015.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where a guide outfitter or assistant guide while guiding for big game

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: guides more than 2 persons at one time, or
fails to accompany a person he is guiding,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: he commits an offence.
A guide outfitter commits an offence where he or, with his knowledge, an assistant guide employed by him guides a hunter outside an area authorized by the guide outfitter's licence.
An assistant guide commits an offence where he guides a hunter outside an area authorized by the guide outfitter's licence of his employer.

Where a person who has not held a guide outfitter licence applies for a guide outfitter licence he shall pay an application fee in the same amount as the late payment fee.
Where the rights to a guide territory are transferred to a guide outfitter, that person shall pay the fee set out in Schedule 1.10.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of this section, a bear gall bladder includes any part or derivative of a bear gall bladder.

For the purpose of subsection (1) (a), a person does not commit an offence respecting possession of a bear gall bladder if, immediately upon killing a bear and cancelling the species licence, he or she moves the bear carcass with the gall bladder attached from the kill site and, within 48 hours of the kill, guts the bear and disposes of the gall bladder.

change.changenote: Section 3.09 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 74/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who kills a furbearing animal under the authority of a licence to hunt wildlife is exempt from paying a royalty in relation to the pelt or skin of that animal, unless he intends to offer the pelt or skin for sale.

change.changenote: Section 3.09 (2) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who kills a furbearing animal under the authority of a licence to hunt wildlife is exempt from paying a royalty in relation to the pelt or skin of that animal, unless he or she intends to offer the pelt or skin for sale.

Despite subsection (2), a person who kills a furbearing animal under the authority of a licence to hunt wildlife is exempt from paying a royalty in relation to the pelt or skin if he or she sells the pelt or skin to a licensed fur trader.

change.changenote: Section 3.09 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 112/2021, effective April 22, 2021.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 73 of the Act, the royalty per pelt or skin is set at 3% of the average price paid at auction in Canada for the pelt or skin of the particular species during the preceding three years, as determined by the director responsible for the wildlife program.

change.changenote: Section 3.09 (2) and (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 12/2022, effective January 17, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who kills a furbearing animal under the authority of a licence to hunt wildlife is exempt from paying a royalty in relation to the pelt or skin of that animal, unless the person intends to offer the pelt or skin for sale.

Despite subsection (2), a person who kills a furbearing animal under the authority of a licence to hunt wildlife is exempt from paying a royalty in relation to the pelt or skin if the person sells the pelt or skin to a licensed fur trader.

change.changenote: section 3.10 (b) (i) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 112/2021, effective April 22, 2021.
Section 3.11 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 74/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The holder of a licence or permit to trap fur bearing animals or a person who is exempted from holding a licence is, for the purposes of trapping, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b) of the Act, and a person who transports him or fur bearing animals taken by him is, for those purposes, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b).

change.changenote: Section 3.11 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 64/2021, effective March 11, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The holder of a licence or permit to trap fur bearing animals or a person who is exempted from holding a licence is, for the purposes of trapping, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b) of the Act, and a person who transports him or her or fur bearing animals taken by him or her is, for those purposes, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b).

change.changenote: Section 3.11 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 112/2021, effective April 22, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The holder of a licence or permit to trap fur bearing animals or a person who is exempted from holding a licence is, for the purposes of trapping, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b) of the Act, and a person who transports that person or fur bearing animals taken by that person is, for those purposes, exempt from the operation of section 27 (2) (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: No person shall continue to hold a registered trapline unless he or she

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: renews his or her licence,
carries on active trapping on his or her registered trapline to the satisfaction of the regional manager,
obtains permission from the regional manager to temporarily discontinue the use of his or her registered trapline for a period not exceeding 2 years, or
uses or causes the use of his or her trapline by a licensed trapper or a person exempted from holding a licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where a person fails to comply with subsection (1), the regional manager shall cancel the registration of his or her trapline.

change.changenote: Section 3.15 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 74/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: except where it is unreasonable to expect that value of animals or pelts to be harvested from the trapline.
